* Starting point of BobBot. Wires together I/O, parsing, storage and the task model.

*
  • Mutates the task list and persists via {@link bobbot.storage.Storage}

* Launches the application and starts the main command loop.

* Handles the mark command to mark a task as completed.
* Retrieves the task by index, marks it as done, displays confirmation, and saves changes.
* @param args command arguments where args[0] is the 1-based task index
* @throws Exception if the task index is invalid or parsing fails
private void handleMark(String[] args) throws Exception {
* Handles the unmark command to mark a task as not completed.
* Retrieves the task by index, marks it as not done, displays confirmation, and saves changes.
* @param args command arguments where args[0] is the 1-based task index
* @throws Exception if the task index is invalid or parsing fails
private void handleUnmark(String[] args) throws Exception {
* Handles the todo command to create a new todo task.
* Creates a new Todo task with the given description, adds it to the task list,
* @param args command arguments where args[0] is the task description
* @throws Exception if the description is empty or invalid
private void handleTodo(String[] args) throws Exception {
throw new BobException("BOBZ!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty bobz.");
* Handles the deadline command to create a new deadline task.
* Creates a new Deadline task with description and due date, adds it to the task list,
* @param args command arguments where args[0] is the description and args[1] is the deadline
* @throws Exception if the format is invalid or required arguments are missing
private void handleDeadline(String[] args) throws Exception {
ui.showError("BOBZ!!! Invalid format for deadline bobz. Try: deadline <desc> /by <time>");
* Handles the event command to create a new event task.
* Creates a new Event task with description, start time, and end time,
* adds it to the task list, displays confirmation, and saves changes.
* @param args command arguments where args[0] is description, args[1] is start time, args[2] is end time
* @throws Exception if the format is invalid or required arguments are missing
private void handleEvent(String[] args) throws Exception {
ui.showError("BOBZ!!! Invalid format for event bobz. Try: event <desc> /from <start> /to <end>");
Task task = new Event(args[0].trim(), args[1].trim(), args[2].trim());
* Handles the delete command to remove a task from the list.

* @param args command arguments where args[0] is the 1-based task index
* @throws Exception if the task index is invalid or parsing fails

* Main entry point for the BobBot application.
* Creates a new BobBot instance with default file path and starts the application.
* Represents an exception specific to BobBot application.
* Used to handle application-specific error conditions with custom error messages.
* Creates a new BobException with the specified error message.
* @param message Error message describing the exception.
* Parses user input commands and converts them into structured Command objects.
* Supports various command types including task creation, modification, and deletion.
* Enumeration of all supported command types in BobBot.
* Each type corresponds to a specific user action or operation.
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, INVALID
* Represents a parsed command with its type and associated arguments.
* Encapsulates the command type and any parameters needed for execution.
* Constructs a new Command with the specified type and arguments.
* @param arguments the arguments associated with the command
* Returns the type of this command.
* Returns the arguments associated with this command.
* @return an array of string arguments for this command
* Parses a user input string and returns the corresponding Command object.
* Analyzes the input to determine command type and extracts relevant arguments.
* @param input the user input string to parse
* @return a Command object representing the parsed command and its arguments
* Handles saving and loading of tasks to/from a file.
* Tasks are stored in a human-readable format that matches the display format.
* Creates a new Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath Path to the file where tasks will be stored.
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file.
* Creates the data directory if it doesn't exist.
* Tasks are saved in display format with numbering.
* @param tasks List of tasks to save.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
public void saveTasks(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {

* Skips any lines that cannot be parsed correctly.

// File doesn't exist yet, start with empty list

* Parses a task from the saved display format.

* @return Task object if parsing succeeds, null otherwise.
private Task createTaskByType(char taskType, String content) {

String deadline = content.substring(byIndex + 6, content.length() - 1); // Remove the closing ")"
* Parses an event task from its stored content format.
* Extracts the description, start time, and end time from the stored format.

* @return an Event task object, or null if parsing fails
String timeInfo = content.substring(fromIndex + 8, content.length() - 1); // Remove the closing ")"
* Represents a deadline task with a due date.
* Supports both formatted dates (yyyy-MM-dd) and free-form text.
private static final DateTimeFormatter DISPLAY_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Creates a new Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* Attempts to parse the date in yyyy-MM-dd format, falls back to original string if parsing fails.
* @param desc Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Due date in yyyy-MM-dd format or free-form text.
* Parses a date string into a LocalDate object.
* Supports both input format (yyyy-MM-dd) and display format (MMM dd yyyy) for file loading.
* @return LocalDate object if parsing succeeds, null otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task.
* Formats the date as "MMM dd yyyy" if parsable, otherwise uses original input.
* The format is [D][X] description (by: date) if done, or [D][ ] description (by: date) if not done.
* @return String representation of this deadline task.
* Represents an event task with start and end times.
* Supports both formatted datetime (yyyy-MM-dd HHmm) and free-form text.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter DISPLAY_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");
* Creates a new Event task with the specified description and time period.
* Attempts to parse datetime in yyyy-MM-dd HHmm format, falls back to original string if parsing fails.
* @param desc Description of the event task.
* @param from Start time in yyyy-MM-dd HHmm format or free-form text.
* @param to End time in yyyy-MM-dd HHmm format or free-form text.
public Event(String desc, String from, String to) {
* Parses a datetime string into a LocalDateTime object.
* Supports both input format (yyyy-MM-dd HHmm) and display format (MMM dd yyyy HHmm) for file loading.
* @return LocalDateTime object if parsing succeeds, null otherwise.
// Try parsing yyyy-mm-dd HHmm format first (input format)
// Try parsing display format "MMM dd yyyy HHmm" (when loading from file)
// If both parsing attempts fail, return null and keep original string
* Returns a string representation of this event task.
* Formats datetime as "MMM dd yyyy HHmm" if parsable, otherwise uses original input.
* The format is [E][X] description (from: start to: end) if done, or [E][ ] description (from: start to: end) if not done.
* @return String representation of this event task.
* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* This is the base class for all task types.
* Creates a new Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of this task.
* The format is [X] description if done, or [ ] description if not done.
* This is the simplest type of task with just a description and completion status.
* Creates a new Todo task with the specified description.
* @param desc Description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of this todo task.
* The format is [T][X] description if done, or [T][ ] description if not done.
* @return String representation of this todo task.
* Manages a collection of tasks with operations to add, delete, and retrieve tasks.
* Provides a wrapper around ArrayList with additional validation and error handling
* Initializes the internal task collection as an empty ArrayList.

* Used primarily for loading existing tasks from storage.
* @param tasks the initial collection of tasks to populate this TaskList
* Adds a new task to the end of the task list.

* Deletes and returns the task at the specified index.
* Removes the task from the list permanently.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to delete
* @return the Task that was removed from the list
* @throws BobException if the index is out of bounds
public Task deleteTask(int index) throws BobException {

* Provides bounds checking and throws appropriate exceptions for invalid indices.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to retrieve
* @return the Task at the specified index
* @throws BobException if the index is out of bounds
public Task getTask(int index) throws BobException {

* @return the Task at the specified index
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of bounds

* @return the size of the task collection
* Checks if this TaskList contains no tasks.

* Returns the underlying ArrayList of tasks.
* Used primarily for storage operations and iteration.

* Handles all user interface operations for BobBot.
* Manages input/output interactions, displays messages, and formats output
* in a consistent style with BobBot's personality.
private static final String GREETING_MESSAGE = "Hello! I'm BobBot";
private static final String PROMPT_MESSAGE = "What can I do for you bobz?";
private static final String GOODBYE_MESSAGE = "Bye bobz. Hope to see you again soon bobz!";
private static final String TASK_ADDED_MESSAGE = "Got it bobz. I've added this task:";
private static final String TASK_COUNT_MESSAGE = "Now you have %d tasks in the list bobz.";
private static final String TASK_MARKED_MESSAGE = "Nice bobz! I've marked this task as done bobz:";
private static final String TASK_UNMARKED_MESSAGE = "OK bobz, I've marked this task as not done yet bobz:";
private static final String TASK_DELETED_MESSAGE = "Noted bobz. I've removed this task bobz:";
private static final String EMPTY_LIST_MESSAGE = "No items in the list bobz.";
private static final String LIST_HEADER_MESSAGE = "Here are the items in your list bobz:";

* Used to separate different sections of output for better readability.

* @param message the error message to display

* Shows the task that was unmarked with appropriate formatting.
* @param task the Task that was marked as not done
* Displays a confirmation message when a task is deleted.
* Shows the deleted task and the updated total count of remaining tasks.
* @param task the Task that was deleted
* @param totalTasks the total number of tasks remaining in the list after deletion
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int totalTasks) {

* Shows each task with its index number, or a message if the list is empty.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing all tasks to display
* Displays the list of tasks that match the search criteria.
* Shows "No matching tasks found" if the list is empty, otherwise
* displays all matching tasks with their index numbers.
* @param matchingTasks TaskList containing tasks that match the search keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list bobz:");
